 215 -def log(ofpList, msgList, linePrefix=None): 

 216      """ 
 217      General logging function. 
 218   
 219      @param ofpList: A container of file objects to write to 
 220   
 221      @param msgList: A container of (or a single) multi-line log message 
 222                 string. Final newlines are not required 
 223   
 224      @param linePrefix: A prefix to add before every line. This will come 
 225                    *after* the log function's own '[time] [hostname]' 
 226                    prefix. 
 227   
 228      @return: Returns a boolean tuple of size ofpList indicating the success of 
 229        writing to each file object 
 230      """ 
 231      msgList = lister(msgList) 
 232      ofpList = setzer(ofpList) 
 233      retval = [True] * len(ofpList) 
 234      for msg in msgList : 
 235          # strip final trailing newline if it exists: 
 236          if (len(msg) > 0) and (msg[-1] == "\n") : msg = msg[:-1] 
 237          linePrefixOut = "[%s] [%s]" % (timeStrNow(), siteConfig.getHostName()) 
 238          if linePrefix is not None : linePrefixOut += " " + linePrefix 
 239          # split message into prefixable lines: 
 240          for i, ofp in enumerate(ofpList): 
 241              # skip io streams which have failed before: 
 242              if not retval[i] : continue 
 243              try : 
 244                  for line in msg.split("\n") : 
 245                      ofp.write("%s %s\n" % (linePrefixOut, line)) 
 246                  hardFlush(ofp) 
 247              except IOError: 
 248                  retval[i] = False 
 249      return retval

 455      except AttributeError: 
 456          # python version < 2.5 
 457          pass 
 458   
 459      id2name = {}

 463          # python version < 2.6 
 464          pass 
 465

 467          dumpfp.write("ActiveThreadCount: %i\n" % (len(tnames))) 
 468          dumpfp.write("KnownActiveThreadNames:\n") 
 469          for name in tnames : dumpfp.write("  %s\n" % (name)) 
 470          dumpfp.write("\n") 
 471          return 
 472   
 473      dumpfp.write("ActiveThreadCount: %i\n" % (len(frames))) 
 474      dumpfp.write("KnownActiveThreadNames:\n") 
 475      for name in tnames : dumpfp.write("  %s\n" % (name)) 
 476      dumpfp.write("\n") 
 477

 479          dumpfp.write("Thread: %d %s\n" % (tid, id2name.get(tid, "NAME_UNKNOWN")))

 481              dumpfp.write('File: "%s", line %d, in %s\n' % (filename, lineno, name)) 
 482              if line is not None: 
 483                  dumpfp.write("  %s\n" % (line.strip()))
